reviews.text: It's now a Comfort Inn. The room was typical for this type of hotel and easy access to I-20. They ran out of orange juice for breakfast. The beds were made while we were gone but none of the used drinking glasses were thrown away or replaced. I would try other hotels in the area before I would return to this hotel.
reviews.title: you could find better

reviews.text: This was my first stay at a Fairfield Inn. I am a frequent traveler and Marriott reward member so I chose this over the HI Express. I was very surprised. It was clean and appeared rather nice, but ZERO amenities! Friendly front desk, but they acted liked I was "problem guests" by requesting sheets for the sleeper sofa. Heaven forbid I ask for an ice bucket for the ice machine! The bed was extremely uncomfortable. The breakfast was ok, but not well serviced or user friendly. I must say I felt that it was overpriced for the lack of quality in all aspects.
reviews.title: A little surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in town at the same time as the BIG horse show in Camden - stayed 2 nights at Fairfield Inn. VERY pleasant front desk, VERY clean rooms (LOVED the gorgeous suite we had the 1st night....). EZ access from I-20, very good food next door at Fatz ...... overall, I would readily stay here again on our next visit to Camden. I just hope all the horse show crowd isn't here again........ contestants were REALLY nice, not-so-great reviews for the spectators ....... :o)
reviews.title: Very nice!

likes.liked: — EZ in & out, and access to I-20 Plus the walking -distance access to Fatz (local restaurant - Great food)
likes.disliked: — The drunken guests for the horse show.

reviews.title: Came to Camden & Found Fairfield Inn
reviews.text: Had a choice between the new HI Express and new-looking Fairfield Inn across the street from each other off I-20, and decided on Fairfield - just a couple of dollars less for the night's stay. Everything was excellent for your road warrior businessman. Had very delicious dinner next door at Fatz, too.

We stayed here on our way home from a practice round at the Masters. It was a perfect stop 100 miles from Augusta. Very easy on/easy off to Route 20. Very quite hotel near a McDonalds/Exxon. The front desk was very nice and suggested local restaurants for us to dine at. The rooms were clean and nice. It is an excellent place to lay your head while traveling and the breakfast was good too!
reviews.title: Good place to stop overnight if traveling on Route 20
